TopicTitle: 'Locking' parts of your vessel in editor

Articles.Content:
When you build vessels it would be nice to have the option to 'lock' your vessel at some point in it's 'tree' structure.

Everything past the lockpoint is fair game, but all from root to the locked part is immune to all clicks until you unlock it.

 

Would it be useful for you ?

Ctrl+Z to undo kind of makes this proposed function a moot point.

It's already impossible to "mess up" your build since you can just undo whatever it is you accidentally changed.

That said, I'm certainly not against it. Some people may find it to be very handy I'd assume.
i was more thinking of those moments when you try to grab some tiny part and always get the wrong one, like stuff in cargo bays, would be much more comfortable to do when the 'obstacles' are locked.

2 hours ago, micr0wave said:

i was more thinking of those moments when you try to grab some tiny part and always get the wrong one, like stuff in cargo bays, would be much more comfortable to do when the 'obstacles' are locked.

Ahh, I see what you're saying.

I use KER (Which tells you which part you are mousing over with a little text box.) and WASD editor camera. (Which let's you fly about the editor like a floating head, allowing you to fly right into a service bay for example.) so I rarely run into that problem, but I'm sure lot's of stock players do.

I can't see any reason it shouldn't be added as an option.

Locked parts under troll struts.

The hitbox is small and I usually grab what lies beneath the strut, even after zooming in and highlighting just the strut.  I think the mouse moves when clicked.

 

Now I use the translate tool and move it first, otherwise it is ctrl-Z for about a minute. 

The KER mod helps out loads because the part is identified when moused over.

Personally I would like the option menu (right click) be able to select the part to delete or move and gizmo the part.  These windows lock and would be great to use on hidden or obscured parts when you need to re orient the screen after selecting the part.
